sect2.title: Introduction to Inetutils
sect2.para: The Inetutils package contains network clients and servers.

sect2.title: Installation of Inetutils
sect2.para: Install Inetutils by running the following commands:

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --disable-logger: This switch prevents Inetutils installing a logger program, which is installed in the LFS Book.
--disable-syslogd: This switch prevents Inetutils installing a System Log Daemon, which is installed in the LFS Book.
--with-wrap: This switch makes Inetutils compile against tcp-wrappers. Add this option if you want to utilize tcp-wrappers.
--disable-whois: This switch will prevent Inetutils installing an outdated whois client. Add this option if you plan on installing .
--with-pam: This switch makes Inetutils link against Linux-PAM libraries. Add this option if you want to utilize PAM.

--disable-servers: Some of the servers included with Inetutils are insecure in nature and in some cases better alternatives exist. You can choose this switch to enable only the servers you need, avoiding the installation of unneeded servers.

sect2.para: The Inetutils package contains network clients and servers.

sect3.para: ping sends ICMP ECHO_REQUEST packets to network hosts.

sect3.title: syslogd
sect3.para: syslogd logs systems messages.

sect3.title: talk
sect3.para: talk allows communication between users.

sect3.title: telnet

sect3.title: whois
sect3.para: whois is a client for the whois directory service.
